department.dept_long_name: Department of Visual and Environmental Studies

course.title: Surface Tensions
course.description: "Surface" considered as formal quality and useful tool. Whether taken to mean literal materials, the chain of ideas cohering a body of work, or painting's Teflon-like durability as cultural tradition, we'll pursue strategies to engage surface: seriality, alternative supports, facture/blur; mechanical tools, casualness and formality. Of particular interest are the challenges posed by seamlessness both in photographic sources and in conversations surrounding abstraction. Emphasis on painting, but other disciplines are welcome.
course.prerequisites: At least one VES half-course in studio, or permission of the instructor.
